pr_title: Support unmapped fields in search 'fields' option

timeline.message:
Support unmapped fields in search 'fields' option

Currently, the 'fields' option only supports fetching mapped fields. Since
'fields' is meant to be the central place to retrieve document content, it
should allow for loading unmapped values. This change adds implementation and
tests for this feature.

Closes #63690

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe we could stick to a nullable Boolean, for consistency with the format parameter and what we do elsewhere in the search builder code?
In mapping code I've also seen us use the Explicit class for this purpose (distinguishing between a value that was set explicitly vs. default).
timeline.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: Sure, I'll look into Explicit, I personally really dislike using null as carrying semantic meaning like unset, which is my main motivation for Optional here.
replies.author: cbuescher

replies.bodyText: After trying Explicit I went with the null option here although I don't like it, but it seems the least complex here.
replies.author: cbuescher

replies.bodyText: I do agree it's not ideal, but great that it's consistent and keeps the constructors simple!
replies.author: jtibshirani

timeline.bodyText: Looks like includeUnmapped is unused here. Also, the number of addFetchField methods is adding up, some builders like TopHitsAggregationBuilder have three. Maybe we should switch to passing FieldAndFormat directly as an argument? We could still retain a single convenience method like addFetchField(String name).

replies.bodyText: sure. Will try to reduce it to a convenience method and one using FieldsAndFormat

Here I wanted to test various field pattern behaviours for object structures in an isolated test. So I think its not ideal to merge them.

timeline.bodyText:
Nice test coverage! Some other cases that'd be good to check:

Source documents that have dots in field names (like unmapped_field.a: value).
Mixed dot and object notation. We recently found a bug in the 'fields' option related to this: #65499.
timeline.author: jtibshirani

timeline.bodyText: I just noticed -- maybe we could switch fieldContexts to a LinkedHashMap? Then we could consult its key set and avoid creating this new set mappedToExclude. I could tackle this in a follow-up though, to keep this PR small.
timeline.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: Interesting idea, I took a quick look and wasn't sure if we have to consider edge cases where the current list might contain different elements with the same field key though. I agree we should probably do this as a follow up in the interest of getting the basics in this PR in first.
replies.author: cbuescher

timeline.bodyText: Small comment, we don't actually guarantee the values come back in the original order. So maybe we should check through something like assertThat(field.getValues(), hasItems(...)).
